text: The Communists' Unity Board (in Spanish: Mesa para la Unidad de los Comunistas) was an electoral coalition in Spain formed to contest the 1986 general election, composed primarily by Santiago Carrillo's split party, the Workers' Party of Spain–Communist Unity.Richard Gunther, José R. Montero, Juan Botella (2004). Democracy in Modern Spain, Yale University Press, pag. 240 ==References== Category:1986 establishments in Spain Category:Defunct communist parties in Spain Category:Defunct political party alliances in Spain Category:Political parties established in 1986
title: Communists' Unity Board
